title: Traverse gorges and ravines in Slovenský raj
itunes:author: The Slovak Spectator
itunes:summary:
With cliffs towering above and water raging below, a visit to Slovenský raj (Slovak Paradise) is not for the faint-hearted (or clumsy). But Briton Jacqui Fay, who worked as a diplomat in Bratislava for three years, insists it is well-worth a visit. This national park in eastern Slovakia, famous for its adventurous paths through waterfalls, gorges and ravines, is not just for fearless rock climbers. 
 
Presenter: Anna Fay
itunes:subtitle: With cliffs towering above and water raging below…
